missionProperties.missionDescription: After waking up in bacta tanks on the Rebel ship Sundered Heart, a distress call from a Rebel hideout on Indu called Jyn and Gaarkhan to action. Accompanying Princess Leia Organa and a strike team, the fresh Alliance recruits set out toward the small forest planet.
missionProperties.additionalMissionInfo: This tutorial will teach you the basics of enemy activation in Imperial Assault.

globalEvents.name: Beginning
globalEvents.eventText:
From the orbit, the forest planet of Indu looks quiet, even peaceful. Princess Leia's face, however, is grim.

"We have received two emergency broadcasts", she explains, pointing at a holographic map. "So we need to split up. I will lead one strike team to the outpost. You land here, on that clearing. Take a look around, and if you don't find anything, rendezvous with us at the outpost."

She deactivates the map and nods toward a shuttle in the hangar. "Maintain radio contact. And good luck."

eventActions.theText:
Your shuttle blasts out of the hangar and soon enters Indu's atmosphere as Leia's shuttle speeds away. A few minutes later, the repulsor engines kick in, and you land on a clearing in the middle of a serene forest. There is some old wreckage and ancient, crumbling ruins, but no sign of an emergency beacon or a Rebel team in need of help.

You search the forest for an hour, finding no traces of Rebel presence before you decide to finally return to your shuttle and contact the Princess.

When you return to the clearing, however, something is off.

Welcome to the second tutorial for Imperial Commander. The first tutorial ran you through the basics of activating heroes. This tutorial will teach you something different: Going face to face with enemies. Just follow the tutorial step by step to find out how this works. First, place Gaarkhan's and Jyn's Hero sheets in the play areas of their respective players, as well as their starting items (the cards from their Hero Class deck without an XP cost).

entityProperties.name: Highlight Gaarkhan
entityProperties.theText: Deploy Gaarkhan here.

entityProperties.name: Highlight Jyn
entityProperties.theText: Deploy Jyn here.

eventActions.theText:
The clearing with the wreckage looks different. You can't put your finger on it, but it feels as if someone has been here recently - someone other than you.

<color="yellow">Place Gaarkhan's miniature on the blue highlighted space, and Jyn's miniature on the green highlighted space.</color>

The time in the open air has been refreshing, and you can feel some of your old strength returning. Search Gaarkhan's Hero class deck for the card Wookiee Loyalty and place it in Gaarkhan's play area. Search Jyn Odan's Hero class deck for the card Smuggler's Luck and place it in Jyn's play area.

<color="yellow">You usually gain cards from your Hero class deck by spending XP between missions, but you get those for free for this tutorial.

Hero class cards give heroes new, unique abilities they can use.</color>

Gaarkhan's Wookiee Loyalty grants him the ability to protect himself or his allies. When he or an adjacent friendly figure is attacked, he may add 1 {G} symbol to the defense results, essentially negating 1 {H} (damage).

Jyn's Smuggler's Luck even has multiple abilities. For this tutorial, only the first ability on the card is relevant, so ignore the others for now. The first ability allows her to reroll any number of dice when performing an attribute test. When, for example, Jyn performs a {I} test but comes up with no {B} symbols (successes), she may reroll any number of dice from that test.

Many abilities have a cost that must be paid. In this case, the card needs to be exhausted. When a card is exhausted, turn them 90 degrees clockwise to indicate it has been used. As long as the card is exhausted, any abilities on it that require it to be exhausted may not be used anymore. Enemy groups are also exhausted by turning them 90 degrees clockwise after they have activated. Hero cards ready again at the start of that hero's activation. At the beginning of a hero's activation, turn all that hero's cards back in the right position. Enemy groups, allies and hero activation tokens ready at the beginning of each round.

You are slowly advancing toward the clearing when you hear a voice, filtered through the mask of a stormtrooper helmet: "Halt, rebels! Surrender now and you will not be harmed!" From behind the wreckage, stormtroopers appear, their weapons ready. Click Continue, then place 3 stormtrooper miniatures on the map as indicated by the app.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

eventActions.theText: Deployed enemy groups are shown to the right, opposite the heroes and their allies. Groups that are ready (they have not acted during this round) have normal thumbnails. Exhausted groups are dimmed.

<color="yellow">The circles under each thumbnail indicate how many figures belong to a group. When a figure is defeated, click / tap one of the circles to turn it red and tell the app that it has been defeated. If you have done so by accident, or need to add another figure for any reason, just click / tap the red circle to turn it green again.

Once the last figure of a group is defeated, you can defeat the entire group.</color>
One of the troopers presses a button on his arm, and energy fields spring up, blocking the way.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 1
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 2
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

eventActions.theText: The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.
Behind the energy field, you can still see the old ruins and your shuttle.

You dive for cover as the stormtroopers, barely waiting for an answer, open fire.

<color="yellow">Usually, the Rebels act first in any given round. For the purpose of the tutorial, though, let's activate the Stormtroopers first.

To start the next Imperial activation, click / tap the pulsing red icon at the bottom left. The app then randomly picks an Imperial group to activate. Once the activation is finished, it's the Rebel's turn again.

Start the next Imperial activation now.</color>

entityProperties.name: Highlight Gaarkhan
entityProperties.theText: Deploy Gaarkhan here.

entityProperties.name: Highlight Jyn
entityProperties.theText: Deploy Jyn here.

eventActions.theText: Start the next Imperial activation.
The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

globalEvents.name: Stormtrooper Activation
globalEvents.eventText: When an enemy group activates, the activation window is displayed. The window consists of three parts: {-} At the top of the window, a random bonus effect is displayed. We'll ignore the bonus effect for now. {-} The right side of the window shows the group's deployment card. {-} The main screen of the instruction window shows the group's instructions.

eventActions.theText: The group's Deployment card shown in the app differs from the Deployment card provided with the game. If you compare them, you can see that the Stormtroopers in the app have no abilities, while the Stormtroopers' card shows the ability Squad Training. This is because some card abilities are not used in the app. Under Ignored Abilities, the app explicitly tells you which card abilities you can ignore. For your convenience, the Deployment cards in the app only show abilities that are not ignored. Ignored abilities are sometimes included in the bonus effects or instructions, however. So you are supposed to ignore the card ability Squad Training, but the Stormtroopers might get a bonus effect also called Squad Training. Only ignore the card abilities, of course. If you want to, you can use Imperial Commander without any physical Deployment cards and only use the ones provided by the app.

The app Deployment card also shows you the group's Surge Abilities. Surge abilities for enemies work the same way as surge abilities for heroes or allies. However, instead of choosing which surge ability to use, simply follow the order given on the app Deployment card until all surges are spent. This is explained in more detail later.

<color="yellow">After you close these tutorial windows, the app will display the Stormtroopers' instructions. Don't worry, you're not supposed to fully understand them yet. 

The app will now provide you with a help token. You don't need to place that token on the map, it's only for tutorial purposes.</color>

entityProperties.name: Explanation Token
entityProperties.theText: This is the instruction explanation token. Once you have closed the Stormtroopers' instruction window, select Explain Instructions to start the explanation.

eventActions.theText: This is the instruction explanation token. Once you have closed the Stormtroopers' instruction window, select Explain Instructions to start the explanation. Now let's open the instruction window. After you close it, open the explanation via the token.
Start the explanation through the explanation token.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">Now let's see how those instructions work. For this explanation, the instructions shown in the first activation are constantly provided above. However, you can always select the {J} icon, then right-click / double-tap the thumbnail of the stormtroopers to call up their last instruction window again. Use this whenever you want to check the instruction window again.

When a group activates, all figures in the group, one after the other, follow the entire instruction list from top to bottom. When one figure has performed all instructions, the next figure activates. Once all figures have been activated, the group's activation ends.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. Figures cannot follow ALL the instructions, however. Instructions preceded by a {A} or {Q} icon require an action. Like heroes and allies, enemies get only 2 actions in each activation, so they can perform a maximum of 2 instructions that are preceded by a {A} or {Q} icon. Instructions not preceded by a {A} or {Q} icon do not cost an action.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. The {Q} icon indicates that an instruction requires an attack action. Remember that heroes are allowed to spend two actions on attacks, but allies and enemies are not. Therefore, an enemy can only resolve 1 instruction preceded by a {Q} symbol each activation.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">When resolving instructions, figures follow the instruction list from top to bottom. They resolve instructions until they have spent 2 actions or reach the bottom line, then the instruction ends.

Figures skip any instruction that is impossible to resolve or that would not alter the game state. This is explained in more detail later.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">Usually, figures in a group activate in an order chosen by the players. For demonstration purposes, though, in this tutorial the stormtrooper deployed to the <color="red">red</color> highlighted space activates first.

Remember that you can click the {J} icon without closing a text window to view the map at any time.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">The first line of the instruction list is:</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.

<color="yellow">This means that the stormtrooper gains 4 movement points and spends them to move as close as possible to Gaarkhan. He stops when he has spent 4 movement points, or is adjacent to Gaarkhan. Any remaining movement points are lost.

If an enemy is instructed to attack a target that cannot be reached or attacked, the enemy targets the closest Rebel figure it can attack instead.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">The app has highlighted more red spaces. Those spaces can all be reached with 4 movement points by the stormtrooper and are at an equal distance to Gaarkhan. So they are all equally valid. 

For the purpose of this tutorial, the stormtrooper moves to the central (slightly more solid) space.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">Now the stormtrooper is in position, and he has line of sight to Gaarkhan. So he attacks the Wookiee. You can see the attack dice on the stormtrooper's Deployment card (1 blue, 1 green). Roll 1 blue and 1 green die. Don't forget to roll Gaarkhan's black defense die, too.

First, check Accuracy. Gaarkhan is 2 spaces away, so check if the numbers on the attack dice add up to at least 2. If they do, the attack hits.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">Next, check if any surges ({B}) were rolled. The stormtrooper can use {B} symbols to activate surge abilities, just like a hero. Select the {J} icon, then right-click / double-tap the stormtrooper's thumbnail to open its Deployment card. There you can see the surge priority:

1. {B}: +2 Accuracy
2. {B}: +1 {H}

If there are any surges, follow the list starting at 1 until all surges are spent. Skip any line that would have no effect. For example, if the stormtrooper already has enough Accuracy, he does not spend a {B} to increase Accuracy by 2.

As usual, {B} symbols are canceled by {F} symbols, in case Gaarkhan rolled a {F}.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. Count all {H} symbols on the attack dice (and those added by surges) and subtract any {G} symbols rolled on the defense die. Also, keep in mind that Gaarkhan has the Wookiee Loyalty class card. If he wants to, he can exhaust it to add an extra {G} to his defense roll. Since the card can be used "while defending", he can wait for the dice results before deciding. If he decides to use the card, exhaust it (turn it 90 degrees clockwise) and add 1 {G} symbol to the results. The remaining {H} is the amount of damage Gaarkhan suffers. For each uncanceled {H}, place one {H} token on his hero sheet.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">This wraps up the first instruction line. The stormtrooper still has an action left, so he moves on to the next line:</color>

{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">This means that the stormtrooper gains 2 movement points and tries to move into a position that is exactly 4 spaces away from all heroes.

If he cannot fulfill this instruction perfectly, for example because he cannot move far enough away from all heroes, he tries to fulfill it as well as he can. This means he moves into a position that is as close as possible to being 4 spaces away from all heroes.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. The red highlighted spaces are all reachable with 2 movement points for the stormtrooper, and also 4 spaces away from both heroes. All three spaces are equally valid. To decide which of the spaces the stormtrooper moves to, you can employ the Imperial Rule.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. Sometimes during mission events or activations, a situation might arise where no clear course for the Empire can be determined from the app. If that is the case, use the Imperial Rule: Choose the option that is worst for the Rebel players.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">In this case, all three spaces are equally valid. However, the topmost space - highlighted in a more solid color in the app - is out of Jyn's line of sight. Since she has a {O} weapon, she could attack the stormtrooper in the two other spaces.

When the stormtrooper moves to the topmost space, though, she needs to move before she can attack him. So this option is worse for the players.

Move the stormtrooper there.

It's up to you whether to use the Imperial Rule or not. You can also simply pick a space at random, if you prefer.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">The stormtrooper has now spent 2 actions, so his activation ends. He does not resolve the last line because he has no actions left. So let's move on to the stormtrooper deployed to the yellow space.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">All figures belonging to the same group follow the same instructions. So the stormtrooper moves to attack Gaarkhan, too.

He gains 4 movement points and advances toward the Wookiee.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. The second stormtrooper's way to Gaarkhan is shorter, though, so he stops when he reaches the space the app just highlighted in yellow. He is now adjacent to Gaarkhan and cannot move any closer. The remaining movement point is lost. He now attacks Gaarkhan by rolling his attack dice versus Gaarkhan's defense die. If Gaarkhan used Wookiee Loyalty on the last attack, he cannot do so again, because the card is already exhausted. Count all {H} and {B} symbols, then subtract any {G} and {F} symbols and apply surges where possible. If Gaarkhan suffers {H}, place more {H} tokens on his hero sheet.

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">After the attack resolves, the stormtrooper moves 2 to reposition 4. However, there is no space he can reach with 2 movement points to fulfill that instruction perfectly.

So he moves to one of the yellow highlighted spaces. They are reachable with 2 movement points and 3 spaces away from both heroes, the best he can do.

Move the stormtrooper to one of the highlighted spaces.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

<color="yellow">This wraps up the second stormtroopers activation. Let's move on to the third stormtrooper who was deployed to the purple highlighted space.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan. {A} Move 2 to reposition 4. {A} Move 6 to reposition 4. By now you should know enough to be able to resolve this activation on your own. Select the {J} icon to view the map again, then resolve the stormtrooper's instructions. Once you're done, click Continue.

<color="yellow">Did the stormtrooper end up on one of the purple highlighted spaces?

If so, well done, especially when you moved him between the blocking terrain, because he would be out of line of sight there.

If not, don't sweat it too much. Minor errors should not detract from the fun.</color>

<color="yellow">Now it's time for revenge. The Stormtroopers' activation ended, so now it's the heroes' turn. But first, let's talk about heroes suffering damage.

Like enemies and allies, heroes can be defeated. When a hero first suffers {H} equal to the hero's Health, discard all {H} and flip the hero sheet to the wounded side. A wounded hero loses some abilities and has worse Speed and Endurance as well as worse attributes, but can still perform actions as before.</color>

When a hero is defeated a second time - meaning when a wounded hero suffers {H} equal to the hero's Health again - , the hero is Withdrawn. This means that he needs to retreat. He is removed from the map and cannot act anymore during this mission. When a hero is Wounded or Withdrawn, select the hero's thumbnail in the app and mark the hero as Wounded or Withdrawn. Remember, since there are only 2 heroes, both heroes' Health is increased by 10.

<color="yellow">Now get back at those Stormtroopers. Resolve activations until the Stormtroopers are defeated. Remember to end the round after the heroes have both resolved two activations. In the next round, the Stormtroopers can act again, but the heroes act first, as usual.

Keep ignoring the Stormtroopers' bonus effects for now. If you ever feel lost, you can re-start the instruction explanation through the explanation token again.</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

{-} Ignore the Stormtroopers' bonus effects.
{-} At any time, you can re-start the instruction explanation with the explanation token.
Defeat the Stormtroopers.

globalEvents.name: Troopers Defeated
globalEvents.eventText: As the last stormtrooper falls under your attacks, you allow yourself a moment to breathe. The Imperial forces stayed hidden when you first arrived and tried to keep you from returning to your shuttle. It was an ambush. And that could mean the other strike team is walking into an ambush, too.

eventActions.theText: Right in that moment, your comlink springs to life. "Guys!", crackles Leia's voice over the device, forgoing any radio protocol. "Be careful! It's an ambush, the forests are crawling with Imps! We're at the outpost, they're blasting us with suppressive fire! Get back to the Sundered Heart while you still can!" You exchange a quick glance. If Leia's strike team is under attack, you're their only hope.

<color="yellow">You need to get back to your shuttle to come to the other team's aid. However, the energy field is still blocking your way.

You already know about interacting with tokens and attribute tests. Sometimes, you have multiple ways to deal with a situation. In this case, you can either destroy the energy fields, or you can try and overcharge them.</color>

To destroy the energy fields, simply attack them as if they were a hostile figure. The energy fields have 8 Health and 1 white die as a defense. Both tokens count as a single target. However, it might be quicker to just shut them off. Jyn is not very strong, but she has an aptitude for technology. And remember that Jyn can exhaust the card Smuggler's Luck to reroll dice.

Many abilities allow you to reroll 1 or more dice. In Jyn's case, Smuggler's Luck allows her to reroll any number of dice when performing an attribute test, as long as she exhausts the card for it. This means that she can roll the dice, and then decide to reroll 1, 2, or all 3 of the dice. Each die can only be rerolled once, though. So if you reroll a die, you have to live with the second result. Remember that she has to exhaust the card, so she can only use this once per activation. At the beginning of her next activation, the card readies again.

<color="yellow">In many cases, you need more than a single success to pass a test. The app usually won't tell you how many you need, though.

When you roll successes, but don't manage to pass the test, place a number of strain tokens ({C}) on or next to the token you just attempted the test on. The next time you repeat that attribute test, add 1 {B} symbol for each strain token on the target, then discard all strain tokens from the target. This way, you can accumulate successes until you eventually pass the test.</color>
<color="yellow">Now get rid of the energy fields, either by destroying or by deactivating them.</color>

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 1
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them. The energy fields have Health 8 and Defense: 1 white die. Both tokens count as a single target. Rebel figures can either attack an energy field or interact with it to deactivate it. When the energy fields have suffers at least 8 {H}, select Destroy. If you want to deactivate them, you can spend an action to interact with them and select {A} Deactivate.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 2
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them. The energy fields have Health 8 and Defense: 1 white die. Both tokens count as a single target. Rebel figures can either attack an energy field or interact with it to deactivate it. When the energy fields have suffers at least 8 {H}, select Destroy. If you want to deactivate them, you can spend an action to interact with them and select {A} Deactivate.

entityProperties.name: Explanation Token
entityProperties.theText: This is the instruction explanation token. Once you have closed the Stormtroopers' instruction window, select Explain Instructions to start the explanation.

eventActions.theText: Destroy or deactivate the energy fields.

{-} The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them. {-} The energy fields have Health 8 and Defense: 1 white die. Both tokens count as a single target. {-} Rebel figures can either attack an energy field or interact with it to deactivate it. When the energy fields have suffers at least 8 {H}, select Destroy. If you want to deactivate them, you can spend an action to interact with them and select {A} Deactivate.

globalEvents.name: Jyn Wounded
globalEvents.eventText:
Jyn cries out as another attack throws her to the ground, but she quickly scampers back to her feet.

<color="yellow">Discard all {H} tokens from Jyn Odan's hero sheet, then flip the sheet. Jyn is wounded, but she can keep on fighting.</color>

globalEvents.name: Gaarkhan Wounded
globalEvents.eventText:
Gaarkhan roars, blood pouring from his wounds and staining his fur. He grabs his axe tighter.

<color="yellow">Discard all {H} tokens from Gaarkhan's hero sheet, then flip the sheet. Gaarkhan is wounded, but he can keep on fighting.</color>

globalEvents.name: Jyn Withdrawn
globalEvents.eventText:
More attacks rain down on Jyn, and she finally has no other choice: Shooting wildly into the direction of the attackers, she retreats into the underbrush.

<color="yellow">Remove Jyn's miniature from the map. She can no longer act during the mission.</color>

globalEvents.name: Gaarkhan Withdrawn
globalEvents.eventText:
Attack after attack hit Gaarkhan, and even the mightiest Wookiee cannot withstand such an onslaught. Roaring in pain, Gaarkhan retreats into the forest.

<color="yellow">Remove Gaarkhan's miniature from the map. He can no longer act during the mission.</color>

globalEvents.name: Both Heroes Withdrawn
globalEvents.eventText:
With Jyn and Gaarkhan both gone, nobody is left to stop the Empire on Indu.

<color="yellow">Since both heroes are withdrawn, this mission has come to an end. You either had horribly bad luck with your dice rolls, or you just tried it out to see what would happen. Anyway, don't worry! You can always just restart the tutorial.</color>

globalEvents.name: Energy Field Attempt
globalEvents.eventText: You try and overcharge the energy field to shut it down.

eventActions.theText: Perform a {I} test. If there are any strain tokens on the energy fields, apply +1 {B} symbols for each strain token on them, then discard all strain tokens from the energy fields. Remember that Jyn can exhaust Smuggler's Luck to reroll any number of dice. Enter the number of successes below.

inputList.theText:
You fiddle with the electronics and make some progress, but you need to keep trying.

<color="yellow">If you rolled any {B} symbols, place a number of strain tokens ({C}) equal to the rolled {B} symbols on the energy fields. These are the successes you have already achieved.</color>

globalEvents.name: Energy Field Removed
globalEvents.eventText: The energy field flickers, then shuts down, freeing the way to the shuttle.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 1
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 2
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

eventActions.theText: The noise of the fight, however, appears not to have gone unnoticed. As you advance toward your shuttle, you hear a burst of static, then the hum of a repulsor drive. Shortly after, an Imperial drone appears over the nearby ruins.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{Q} Move 2 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 3.
{A} Move 4 to reposition 3.

eventActions.theText: Select the {J} icon and right-click / double-tap to open the Probe Droid's Deployment card. You can see that the Probe Droid has the keyword Mobile. Mobile figures treat all terrain as regular terrain. This means that the Probe Droid can move through red lines (dotted or solid) and does not need to spend extra movement points to move through difficult terrain (blue lines) or Rebel figures. Keep this in mind when resolving their instructions.
You ready your weapons when you hear a second burst of static. Another droid appears on the other stairs.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{Q} Move 2 to attack {rebel}.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 3.
{A} Move 4 to reposition 3.

eventActions.theText:
<color="yellow">Now there are two identical groups on the map. To differentiate between them, you can assign them colors.

Select the {J} icon to view the map and the deployment groups. At the top left of a group's thumbnail is a grey circle. Click / tap that circle to cycle between colors. You can assign each Probe Droid a different color. That color is also shown in the activation window so you know which group just activated.

To differentiate between the figures, you can for example use the colored stickers provided with the game.</color>

<color="yellow">By now, you should be able to resolve the Probe Droid's instructions on your own. For now, keep ignoring any bonus effects.

Blast those droids!</color>
Defeat the Probe Droids.
{-} Ignore the Probe Droids' bonus effects.

globalEvents.name: Stormy Defeated Early
globalEvents.eventText: <color="yellow">You can't defeat the Stormtroopers yet. They will now be re-deployed. Click  / tap the red icon at the bottom left to activate them first, then start the explanation via the explanation token.</color>

enemyGroupData.customText:
{Q} Move 4 to attack Gaarkhan.
{A} Move 2 to reposition 4.
{A} Move 6 to reposition 4.

globalEvents.name: Vader Appears
globalEvents.eventText:
The last Imperial droid explodes in a shower of debris, but before you can celebrate your victory, Leia's voice crackles through the comlink. This time, she sounds almost panicked.

"GET OUT THERE! HE IS COM-"

The transmission cuts off, and a sudden sense of oppressive dread falls upon you.

eventActions.theText: Without a warning, the trees behind you are smashed to the side by an invisible force, revealing a narrow path through the forest.

At the end of the path stands a towering figure in black armor, watching you silently.

Then, with a hissing snap, a lightsaber ignites, bathing the forest in ominous red.

enemyGroupData.customText:
{Q}{A} BRUTALITY: Move 4 to engage 2 or more Rebels. Then, attack each adjacent Rebel.
{Q} Move 4 to attack {rebel}.
{A} FORCE CHOKE: Move 2 toward {rebel}. Then {rebel} suffers 2 {H} and is pushed 1 space toward <color="red">Darth Vader</color>.
{A} Move 6 toward {rebel}.

eventActions.theText: This enemy is beyond you. You need to get out. Now.

Darth Vader is an Elite figure. Elite figures can be differentiated from regular figures by the red card border (or the red color in the app Deployment card). Elites have better stats than regular groups and sometimes special abilities. In this mission, Darth Vader cannot suffer {H}. Any damage you inflict on him is automatically discarded. He cannot be defeated. All you can do is flee.

Vader's sight fills you with fear, freezing you to your spots for a moment.

<color="yellow">The current hero's activation ends immediately. Click / tap the red icon at the bottom left to activate <color="red">Darth Vader</color>.
Start the next Imperial activation.
{-} <color="red">Darth Vader</color> cannot suffer {H} and cannot be defeated.

globalEvents.name: Vader Activation
globalEvents.eventText:
<color="yellow">Vader's attack is a {P} (melee) attack. This means that he needs to close in to attack you, which might be your only hope for survival.

Darth Vader is also powerful, so let's stop ignoring bonus effects. You need to cope with them for the rest of the mission.</color>

eventActions.theText:
<color="yellow">Bonus effects are always displayed at the top of the activation window. There are usually multiple bonus effects which are randomly selected when a group activates. They apply to the entire activation of every figure in the group.

Let's run through the possible bonus effects for <color="red">Darth Vader</color>. Vader has three possible bonus effects.</color>

1. DETERMINATION: Apply +1 {H} to each attack. At the end of this figures activation, this figure suffers 2 {H}. This means that each attack by Darth Vader inflicts 1 additional {H}. Ignore the second part of the bonus effect: In this mission, Darth Vader cannot suffer {H}, so you just ignore it. If Darth Vader doesn't attack in his activation, you got lucky.

2. CRUEL AURA: At the end of this figures activation, each Rebel adjacent to this figure suffers 1 {H}. This means that if Darth Vader ends his activation adjacent to any Rebel, that Rebel suffers 1 {H}. Stay away from him.

3. FORCE PULL: At the start of this figures activation, push the closest Rebel 2 spaces toward this figure. This does exactly what it says. As soon as Darth Vader activates, the closest Rebel is pushed 2 spaces toward Darth Vader. Note that this does not require line of sight. Vader can pull Rebels toward him wherever they are on the map. Also note that being pushed or moving X spaces is not the same as spending movement points. When something moves you spaces, such as pushing, you gain no movement points. This also means that you can move through spaces with difficult terrain or hostile figures without spending additional movement points.
<color="yellow">Finally, let's give you another explanation token.</color>

entityProperties.name: Vader's Explanation Token
entityProperties.theText: This is Vader's instruction explanation token. Once you have closed Darth Vader's instruction window, select Explain Instructions to start the explanation.

eventActions.theText: <color="yellow">You already know the drill. After closing Vader's activation window, call up the instruction explanations with the token.</color>
Open the explanation through the explanation token.

globalEvents.name: Vader Explanation
globalEvents.eventText: <color="yellow">Let's go through <color="red">Darth Vader</color>'s instructions. This time, we won't repeat the instructions at the top. You already know that you can select the {J} icon to view the map, then right-click / double-tap Vader's thumbnail to re-open his activation window.</color>

eventActions.theText: First, resolve the bonus effect. Vader is so far away that for his first activation, DETERMINATION will probably have no effect. If the bonus effect is CRUEL AURA, keep it in mind. If it is FORCE PUSH, place the closest Rebel 2 spaces closer to Vader.

The first line is: {Q}{A} BRUTALITY: Move 4 to engage 2 or more Rebels. Then, attack each adjacent Rebel. There is a bit to unpack here. First, the two symbols {Q}{A} mean that this instruction requires two actions instead of one. If Vader performed this instruction, his activation would end after it, because he would have no actions left. The instruction means that he gains 4 movement points and moves to "engage", 2 or more Rebels. So he tries to be adjacent to 2 or more Rebels. However, Vader is way too far away for that.

Enemy figures only try to carry out instructions that are possible for them. If something is impossible, like Vader's BRUTALITY, they skip the instruction and instead proceed toward the next line. In this case, since Vader cannot move adjacent to any target with 2 movement points, he skips the instruction.

<color="yellow">The second line is:</color>

{Q} Move 4 to attack (hero).

<color="yellow">If Vader could not move adjacent to 2 or more Rebels, he tries to move adjacent to a single target. However, even with 4 movement points, Vader cannot move adjacent to any Rebel. He skips this line, too. He would not have skipped it if he could have attacked a Rebel figure other than the named hero, however. If an enemy cannot attack the given Rebel, but can attack another Rebel, he does so.

Note that both this and the previous instruction were preceded by a {Q} icon. That means they are attack actions. Non-heroes cannot spend more than 1 action on an attack action, so even if Vader carried out the first instruction and still had actions left, he would have skipped the second line because even he may only perform 1 attack action.

An attack action, however, may include more than 1 attack - like Vader's BRUTALITY.</color>

The third line is: {A} FORCE CHOKE: Move 2 toward (hero). Then (hero) suffers 2 {H} and is pushed 1 space toward Darth Vader. This is an instruction Vader can carry out. First, he gains 2 movement points and moves closer. Enemy figures always try to take the way that would use the fewest movement points, so Vader moves to the space highlighted red by the app.

{A} FORCE CHOKE: Move 2 toward (hero). Then (hero) suffers 2 {H} and is pushed 1 space toward <color="red">Darth Vader</color>.

<color="yellow">Next, the hero named in the instruction suffers 2 {H} and moves 1 space closer to Vader. Again, this does not require line of sight. Vader perceives you through the Force.

This instruction is resolved, and Vader has spent his first action. On to the next line.</color>

The fourth line is: {A} Move 6 toward (hero). Vader gains 6 movement points and moves closer. However, he needs to cross the swamp to approach you. The swamp (highlighted blue) is difficult terrain, so Vader needs 1 additional movement point to cross it. This means that, starting from his current position, Vader can only reach one of the red highlighted spaces. Place his figure there. Vader has now spent both actions, so his activation ends. If the bonus effect is CRUEL AURA and he is adjacent to any Rebel, each Rebel suffers 1 {H}.
You shake off the dread that Vader's sight has brought you. You know that you can't even hope to defeat him, so you remotely activate the engines of your shuttle and unlock the hatch.

entityProperties.name: Shuttle Control
entityProperties.theText:
The shuttle's engines are already humming. It is ready to start.

<color="yellow">When all surviving heroes are on the shuttle, a hero can interact with the terminal to launch the shuttle and end the tutorial.</color>

entityProperties.name: Shuttle Door
entityProperties.theText: The hatch of your shuttle is closed to keep out the humidity of the forest.

eventActions.theText:
<color="yellow">It's time to get out. The shuttle door is now unlocked, so any hero can interact with it to open it.

Once all surviving heroes are on the shuttle (any space behind the door), a hero can interact with the terminal to launch the shuttle and end the second tutorial.

Good luck, and may the Force be with you.</color>
Escape Darth Vader.

<color="yellow"><color="red">Darth Vader</color> cannot suffer {H}.

When all surviving heroes are on the shuttle, a hero can interact with the terminal to launch the shuttle and end the tutorial.</color>

globalEvents.name: End Tutorial
globalEvents.eventText:
The shuttle blasts off into the skies over Indu. Out of the windows you can see Darth Vader standing on the clearing, calmly looking after you, the lightsaber still in his hands.

You quickly gain altitude, then set your course for the coordinates of the other strike team. You have no idea whether you'll get there in time, but you certainly won't give up hope.

eventActions.theText:
<color="yellow">This wraps up the second tutorial. In the third tutorial, you will learn the remaining rules and a few other nuances.

At any time, if you have any questions, consult the Rules Reference Guide for all the details you need.</color>

globalEvents.name: Door Opens
globalEvents.eventText: You punch the access control, and the door slides open.

entityProperties.name: Shuttle Door
entityProperties.theText: The hatch of your shuttle is closed to keep out the humidity of the forest.

entityProperties.name: Highlight Gaarkhan
entityProperties.theText: Deploy Gaarkhan here.

entityProperties.name: Shuttle Door
entityProperties.theText:
The hatch of your shuttle is closed to keep out the humidity of the forest.

{-} The door is locked.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 1
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

entityProperties.name: Energy Field 2
entityProperties.theText: A blue energy shield is blocking the way to the crumbling ruins and your shuttle. The Imperial mission tokens are blocking terrain. This means that line of sight can not be drawn through them and figures cannot move through them.

entityProperties.name: Highlight Jyn
entityProperties.theText: Deploy Jyn here.

entityProperties.name: New Marker
entityProperties.theText: This is the instruction explanation token. Once you have closed the Stormtroopers' instruction window, select Explain Instructions to start the explanation.

entityProperties.name: Vader's Explanation Token
entityProperties.theText: This is Vader's instruction explanation token. Once you have closed Darth Vader's instruction window, select Explain Instructions to start the explanation.

entityProperties.name: New Terminal
entityProperties.theText:
The shuttle's engines are already humming. It is ready to start.

<color="yellow">When all surviving heroes are on the shuttle, a hero can interact with the terminal to launch the shuttle and end the tutorial.</color>
